org.mundo.service
Class ServiceManager

java.lang.Object
  org.mundo.rt.Service
      org.mundo.rt.RootService
          org.mundo.service.ServiceManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
IEmits, Service.IProp, IServiceManager, IPluginMonitor.IPluginHandler
public class ServiceManager
extends RootService
implements IServiceManager, Service.IProp, IPluginMonitor.IPluginHandler

The service manager keeps track of local and remote services.

Loggers: svcman

Method Detail

getInstance

public static ServiceManager getInstance()
Returns the singleton instance of ServiceManager.

init

public void init()
Initializes the service. The service interface is connected to a channel with the name nodeId + ".ServiceManager", where nodeId is the string representation of this node's GUID.

Overrides:
init in class Service

getServiceByName

public Service getServiceByName(java.lang.String name)
Get a service by friendly name. This method only finds local instances. To discover a service on the network, a service discovry with query or contQuery needs to be performed.

getServiceByInterface

public Service getServiceByInterface(java.lang.Class iface)
Get a service by interface. This method only finds local instances. To discover a service on the network, a service discovry with query or contQuery needs to be performed. If multiple services implement the interface, only the first found service is returned.

pluginRegistered

public void pluginRegistered(java.lang.String uri,
                             org.w3c.dom.Node rootNode,
                             java.util.jar.JarFile jar,
                             java.lang.ClassLoader classLoader)
Description copied from interface: IPluginMonitor.IPluginHandler
Called whenever a new plugin is registered for the specific IPluginHandler. It may throw a SyntaxErrorException if the configuration is missing required parts. The method has transaction semantics: In case an exception gets thrown, the system's state after calling pluginRegistered MUST remain the same as before calling it.

Specified by:
pluginRegistered in interface IPluginMonitor.IPluginHandler
Parameters:
uri - the XML namespace of the current configuration node
rootNode - the XML configuration to parse
jar - the JarFile which contained the plugin defintion
classLoader - a classloader already initialized to load classes out of the package's jar file

pluginUnRegistered

public void pluginUnRegistered(java.lang.String uri,
                               org.w3c.dom.Node rootNode)
Description copied from interface: IPluginMonitor.IPluginHandler
Called whenever a plugin is unregistered for a specific IPluginHandler. As unregistration is done via deleting files, there is no way to prevent this. A plugin may be unregistered even if it's registration did not succeed.

Specified by:
pluginUnRegistered in interface IPluginMonitor.IPluginHandler
Parameters:
uri - the XML namespace of the current configuration node
rootNode - the XML configuration for the plugin

contQuery

public ResultSet contQuery(ServiceInfoFilter sif,
                           Session session,
                           ResultSet.ISignal handler)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Starts a service inquiry as continuous query. The services to search for are specified using the filter parameter. The query function returns immediately. For that reason, the returned result set will not immediately contain the complete search result. Always when the result set is updated, the specified handler is notified. When the application is no longer interested in updates, it calls the the release() method. The following example shows how to create a continuous query: 
 ServiceInfoFilter filter = new ServiceInfoFilter();
 ServiceManager.getInstance().contQuery(filter, session, new ResultSet.ISignal() {
   public void updated(final ResultSet rs, int offset, int oldCount, int newCount) {
     System.out.println(rs);
   }
 });

Parameters:
sif - a filter object that will be matched with the service descriptions.
session - the target session. The session will be used to bind the object references contained in the returned ServiceInfo objects. If the object references are not needed, session can be set null.
handler - a handler that will be notified every time the result set changes.
Returns:
a result set containing the ServiceInfo descriptions of the services found.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

query

public ResultSet query(ServiceInfoFilter sif,
                       Session session)
                throws java.lang.Exception
Starts a service inquiry as simple query. The services to search for are specified using the filter parameter. The query function returns immediately. For that reason, the returned result set will not immediately contain the complete search result. The application determines when to end the search by calling the release() method. The following example shows how to use the query function and how to terminate search after three seconds: 
 ServiceInfoFilter filter = new ServiceInfoFilter();
 ResultSet result = ServiceManager.getInstance().query(filter, session);
 Thread.sleep(3000);
 result.release();

Parameters:
sif - a filter object that will be matched with the service descriptions.
session - the target session. The session will be used to bind the object references contained in the returned ServiceInfo objects. If the object references are not needed, session can be set null.
Returns:
a result set containing the ServiceInfo descriptions of the services found.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

advertiseServices

public void advertiseServices()
